document.name: A Modern European Breakfast by chef Clive Fernandes

custom_questions.question: Number of vegetarians in the group?

document.short_description:
About the Meal


This is not your ordinary breakfast menu. It’s for diners looking to try something novel. Inspired by my time at Toronto’s famed Auberge du Pommier and paying homage to their chef patrons, this menu is crafted with carefully sourced ingredients and modern culinary techniques. Chef Clive Fernandes believes food should go beyond sustenance—it should be an experience. Keeping his core philosophy of simplicity and originality in mind, he crafts dishes that are both familiar yet progressive. What sets your brand apart: Oxalis brings modern European gastronomy to the city; no compromises, no shortcuts—just pure, unadulterated, and modern flavors. At Oxalis, we leave no stone unturned when it comes to ingredients used in each dish, delivering high-end artistic plates and an elevated dining experience.


MENU


NON VEGETARIAN


SAUCISSON EN BRIOCHE - Rs. 595

Polish Pork Sausage, Brioche, Port


STEAK & EGGS - Rs. 595

Coffee Tenderloin, Onsen Egg, Pomme Persillade (Gluten- free)


SAUMON - Rs. 665

Fennel Cured Salmon, WHipped Horseradish Crème, Rye Toast


PASTRAMI DE CANARD - Rs. 630

Smoked Muscovy Duck, Butternut Squash, Preserved Berries, Baguette


BACON PAIN PERDU - Rs. 595

Spice Roasted. Plums, Creme Fraiche, Grape Molasses, Bacon Lardon, Brioche


QUICHE LORRAINE - Rs. 560

Asparagus, Shucked Peas, Parmesan, Pork Ham, Confit Onion


VEGETARIAN


WILD & TAME MUSHROOM TARTINE - Rs. 490

Mushroom Mascarpone Pâté, Purslane, Pickles


PANISSE - Rs. 455

Torched Cauliflower, Root Vegetable Ketchup, Espelette Harissa, Chickpea Crumble (vegan, gluten- free)


POMME ALIGOT FOUGASSE - Rs. 539

Braised Breadfruit & Jackfruit, Swiss Cheese Aligot, Espelette Puffed Quinoa & Potato


RIZ AU LAIT - Rs. 490

Rice pudding, Pecan Pralines, Caramel Mousse (vegan, gluten-free)

document.name: The Wonder Years with chefs Ralph & Picu

document.short_description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening celebrating the rich culinary heritage of Goa with two best friends turned culinary stars, Chef Picu and Chef Ralph. These two chefs, now at the forefront of the Goan food scene, have been inseparable since childhood, sharing a bond forged in the vibrant streets of Panjim.


This special dinner menu is an ode to their enduring friendship and the city that has been its backdrop. The dishes showcase the European techniques they've mastered throughout their culinary journeys. The fusion of Portuguese and local influences that define Goan cuisine is beautifully reflected in every bite, each with a contemporary twist that only these talented chefs can create.


Throughout the evening, embark on a culinary journey that feels both modern and nostalgic. The menu draws inspiration from generations-old recipe books of the Gomes Pereira and Prazeres households, infusing the meal with the essence of Goa's rich history.


Experience the magic as these two friends take contemporary Goan cuisine in a new direction, delivering a heartwarming and memorable dining experience that pays tribute to their shared roots and innovative spirit.


Set Menu


NOTE: Seafood allergies & gluten can be accommodated


Non- Veg Menu                                          


Bread Course:

Coriander Chilli Lime/Goan Sausage Butter


Course 1:                                                     

OLMI                                                                    

Grilled morels & truffle.


Course 2:

GRILLED TIGER PRAWNS

Recheado seafood bisque


Course 3:

ROAST BEEF CROQUETTAS

Garlic paprika yoghurt


Course 4:

PAN ROASTED FISH

Kalchi kodi, turmeric mash, onion fennel salad


Course 5:

BEEF TENDERLION

Onion sauce, pepper jus, pomme frittes


COURSE 6:

PASTEIS DE NATA

Portuguese custard tart


Veg Menu  


Bread Course:

Coriander Chilli Lime


Course 1:                                                     

OLMI                                                                    

Grilled morels & truffle


Course 2: 

GRILLED BROCCOLI

Garlic butter & dill yoghurt


Course 3:

JACKFRUIT CROQUETTAS

Garlic paprika yoghurt


Course 4:

GRILLED WHITE ASPARAGUS & PALM HEART

Kalchi kodi, turmeric mash, puffed brown rice


Course 5:

TAMBDI BHAJI LASAGNA

parmesan , goats cheese, caramelised walnuts


Course 6:

PASTEIS DE NATA

Portuguese custard tart

document.name: Mother of All Bake Sales
document.short_description:
Join us for the ultimate bake sale at Courtyard in Bangalore! We are thrilled to host an exceptional lineup of celebrated bakers from across India, each bringing their unique flavors and specialties. Meet and taste the creations of:


  1. Chef Ralph Prazeres from Padaria Prazeres, Goa
  2. Chef Dina Weber from Sapa Bakery, Mysore
  3. Chef Heena Punwani from Maska Bakery, Mumbai
  4. Chef Nida Ali from Market Lane, Chennai


Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to indulge in a variety of delectable baked goods, meet the bakers, and enjoy a day filled with scrumptious treats and delightful conversations. Whether you're a baking enthusiast or just love good food, the "Mother of All Bake Sales" is the place to be!

document.short_description:
Open-air screening with a three-course dinner & popcorn

About the movie:

In "Charlie's Angels" (2000), a high-energy action-comedy, three women—Natalie Cook (Cameron Diaz), Dylan Sanders (Drew Barrymore), and Alex Munday (Lucy Liu)—work as private investigators for the mysterious Charles Townsend, who communicates with them only through a speakerphone. Known collectively as Charlie's Angels, they use their intelligence, beauty, and a wide array of skills to tackle high-stakes missions.


Three-course menu by Chef Mathew


Appetizer

Roasted mixed pepper bruschetta

Mains

Vegetable lasagna

OR

Chicken lasagna

Dessert

Tiramisu

document.address: 20/2, Vittal Mallya Rd, D' Souza Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India
document.booking_confirmation_message:
Hi!

Thank you for registering for the YDI Bangalore Meetup 03! We're super excited to have you join us on Saturday, the 29th of June at 4PM.


The location is The Biere Club, Vittal Mallya Road (right opposite the Vida showroom), on the 2nd floor. The event is for individuals aged 21 and above ONLY, so please bear that in mind.


Your ticket includes a free beer or mocktail at the event! :) This meetup is all about getting to know other members and having a good time, and if you've attended one before, you know what I'm talking about. If you haven't, stay tuned to find out! Don't forget to let loose, but of course, drink responsibly. We highly recommend you make use of public transport if you do plan to drink.


If you have any questions, please reach out to us at youngdesignersin@gmail.com or +91 7483706556.


See you there!
document.cancellation_policy: NO REFUNDS & CANCELLATIONS: If you are unable to make it to the event, we will unfortunately not be able to refund your ticket amount. However, if you know someone who'd like to take your place at the event, please let us know at youngdesignersin@gmail.com and we'll do our best to transfer your ticket. Thank you!

document.short_description:
We're back for our third meetup in Bengaluru and we're excited to host you!

This one's happening on Saturday, 29th June at 4pm, at The Biere Club, Vittal Mallya Road.

Grab a drink, get to know fellow designers, discuss careers, and well, you know the drill. Just have fun!

Your friends are invited too! Just send them this link.

Designers, students, professors this is really for you!


Please note: THIS EVENT IS EXCLUSIVELY FOR INDIVIDUALS 21 YEARS OF AGE AND ABOVE.


What to expect?

Very relaxed meet and greet, casual networking over some snacks and drinks paired with good vibes to get your Saturday evening started. There are limited spots so make sure you grab yours early.


Who are we?

​​YDI is the largest support network for Indian designers living and working across the world (10,000+ members). After hosting events all across the world, YDI is coming back to Bengaluru. Your host is Priya Kini (Industrial Designer at Ather Energy.)


​We look forward to having you join us!


Curious about YDI? 👉 www.youngdesignersindia.com

document.name: Letterpress poster printing
document.short_description:
The art of poster making with your own hands. A fun session to unleash your creative minds, experiment with typographic layout and using types.


Bring along a favourite quote, song lyric or poem perhaps and with our guidance, you can make a fabulous poster print for your wall. We recommend no more than 5 words.


Details

- Create a poster / print for your wall

- Suitable for graphic designers, design enthusiasts, printmakers, type lovers, anyone who wants to create a print with your own hands

All materials required would be provided. You will make two copies of the poster print in A4 size.

custom_questions.question: Where did you hear about us?
If you'd like to join our whatsapp community or would like to know about future events, leave your number.

document.short_description:
Join us for an enchanting Chef's Table in a community-style experience that brings Malnad cuisine to life. This exclusive event takes you on a journey through Karnataka's rich culinary traditions, where age-old recipes meet fresh, local ingredients. Set amidst a vibrant, lush backdrop, our Chef's Table captures the essence of home and tradition. Savour traditional vegetarian and vegan Karnataka dishes like Pathrode, Rice, Hayagreeva, and Mavina Sasuve, meticulously prepared to highlight authentic regional flavours. Indulge in a feast that celebrates the warmth, hospitality, and rich heritage of Malnad, with Dr Darshan's specially curated all-veg and vegan menu making it perfect for food enthusiasts and culture lovers alike. It will be a community-style table seating. Elder & LGBTQ friendly.

Cuisine Description:

Malnad cuisine, from Karnataka's lush Malnad region, highlights fresh, local ingredients and traditional cooking techniques like steaming, slow cooking, and stone grinding. Known for its rich, vibrant flavours, the cuisine reflects the region's diverse communities, including Havyaka Brahmins, Vokkaligas, and Gowdas. Food habits emphasize seasonal and local produce, primarily vegetarian. Staples like coconut, rice, and jaggery are common. Malnad cuisine is a culinary journey that embodies the essence of home, tradition, and the warm hospitality of the Western Ghats.


Who am I?

I’m Dr Darshan Gowda, a dentist turned home chef with a deep passion for reviving age-old, traditional recipes. My culinary journey began in my childhood, watching and assisting my mom and grandmother in the kitchen, which fueled my love for cooking. I specialize in Malnad cuisine and coastal recipes, focusing on vegan and vegetarian dishes. Exploring hidden culinary gems and recreating traditional flavours is my true passion, and I aim to bring the essence of these home-cooked meals to life.

https://www.instagram.com/dr.darshangowda/


Venue: Love OORU﻿

Rooftop / Sunsets / Wine & Grills

﻿https://www.instagram.com/love.ooru/?hl=en

document.name: Sunset Pilates and sharing spread with Aakruti
document.short_description:
Come join us for a Sundowner Pilates class this weekend at The Studio by the Copper + Cloves with Aakruti.

Mat Pilates is a form of exercise that focuses on strengthening the body's core muscles (abdominals, lower back, hips, and buttocks) while also targeting other areas of the body through controlled movements. 

As the sun sets, immerse yourself in a session designed to strengthen, stretch, and restore balance to both body and mind.

After the class, you can experience our local, well-balanced, nutritious and seasonal menu spread. A beautiful way to get to know your peers in our serene space at The Studio.

document.short_description:
Sienna, Calcutta at The Conservatory

Sienna is back in Bangalore this July from the 19th to the 21st with both the kitchen and store teams popping up at the Courtyard. Taking inspiration from the baajars of Bengal, this will be an immersive showcase of both food and design craft.

About the meal

After a well-received baajar-to-table tasting menu at the Conservatory earlier in the year the kitchen team from Sienna helmed by Chefs Avinandan and Koyel are back with an ala carte menu of casual, sharing plates reflecting the best of the bounty of Bengal’s culture and produce. They aim to focus on the bajaars of the region and the menu reflects the seasonality and diversity of the region coupled with techniques from across the globe.

Menu:

Chola’r Daal Hummus, Nimki (V) - Rs. 450

Mushroom XO Rice, King Oyster Jerky (V) - Rs. 550

Potol Poshto, Khosha Bata, Golabhaat (V) - Rs. 550

Ranga Aloo & Pumpkin Gnocchi, Bonolokhi Ghee Sauce (V) - Rs. 650

Chana’r Paturi, Aam Kasundi (V) - Rs. 550

Beef Tartare, Kalabhuna (NV) - Rs. 750

Maach’r Dim XO Rice, Fried Egg (NV) - Rs. 550

Kalojeere Pork, Golabhaat (V)* - Rs. 650

Crab Meat, Deshi Deem, Crab Caramel (NV) - Rs. 750

Golda Chingri, Ghilu Hollandaise (NV) - Rs. 750

Duck, Jhol, Chaaler Ruti (NV) - Rs. 750

Bhetki a la Kiev, Radhuni Butter, Mash (NV) - Rs. 750

Aam Doi, Coconut Cream, Lemon Basil (V) - Rs. 450

Malai Toast Brûlée (V) - Rs. 450

*Contains Egg.

Other offerings at the Sienna, Calcutta Experience

The Pottery Workshop at The Yard

*Book your spot for the workshop separately. Through the link on @thecourtyardcommunity 's Instagram bio.

Travelling with Sienna, Calcutta from their workshop in Santiniketan are senior members of our team who will co-host ceramic workshops for both kids and adults throughout the duration of the residency.

The Pop-up shop at The Studio

*The pop-up shop is free to access.

Named after the colour of the local red soil / রাঙামাটি of Santiniketan, Sienna was born out of a deep appreciation of the rich craft heritage of Bengal. Our creative nerve centre is in Daronda village, Shantiniketan, about 200 km from Calcutta, surrounded by lush greenery, where in 1993 architect & founder Shanta Ghosh built a pottery workshop to support local artisans from the neighbouring areas. Her daughter, now creative head Shuli, took over around 12 years ago. They built the store space in Calcutta in 2015 along with a small family run cafe with home staff trained to serve soups, salads and sandwiches. That space evolved over time, especially since the pandemic, and brought the same level of focus and support to food craft, as they had initially for ceramics and textiles. Today Sienna is a design company proudly representing the finest traditional craft techniques of Bengal and bringing it to a national and global stage for engagement with a wider audience.

The craft residency at the Courtyard will be a comprehensive and experiential showcase of the various craft mediums we work with. From handmade pottery, copper & brass jewellery made with upcycled fabric waste to textiles made with natural fibres and printed with motifs inspired by all things Bengal.

Terms and Conditions :

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.
  • The access to the pop- up shop is free. The pop-up store is open from 11am to 10pm.
  • Ticket price of 1200 is redeemable against food only.
  • Please note that the same kitchen will be used to prepare both vegetarian and non-vegetarian food.
  • Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.
  • No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.
  • Children aged 5 and above require a ticket to attend the meal.
  • Let the Conservatory team know in advance if you are bringing a child below the age of 5 (without a ticket). An extra chair will be provided at the table for the child.
  • The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.
  • Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.
  • Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  • Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.
  • The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.
  • Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

document.name: Pottery Workshop for Beginners (1- Day Workshop) | Sienna, Calcutta at Courtyard
document.short_description:
About the workshop

Enjoy an exclusive, hands-on experience with 2 trainers for every 6 participants. Traveling with us from our workshop in Santiniketan are senior potters from the Sienna, Calcutta family, who will co-host pottery workshops for both kids and adults throughout the residency.

Play with clay

Sienna, Calcutta's senior potters from the Santiniketan will teach the basics of hand-building, pinch, coil & slab pottery. You will be able to create objects, shapes & forms, without using a potter’s wheel - all you need are your hands and some fun shaping & coiling tools which we will provide. A fun session to let you unleash your imagination and creativity and make something unique.

For Beginners (Children between 5 yrs - 12 years) & adults with young hearts

Duration: 2 hours

Terms & Conditions

document.name: Advanced Pottery Workshop (3- Day Workshop) | Sienna, Calcutta at Courtyard
document.short_description:
PLEASE NOTE:

The Workshop will take place over three- days.

About the workshop

Enjoy an exclusive, hands-on experience with 2 trainers for every 6 participants. Traveling with us from our workshop in Santiniketan are senior potters from the Sienna, Calcutta family, who will co-host pottery workshops for both kids and adults throughout the residency.

Shape, throw & mould!

19th July - Day 1

Our master potter & senior designer, and Senior glazing expert will give an introduction to hand-thrown pottery and ceramic arts. We will go through each stage of the pottery-making process with visual aids. We will start by teaching to wedge the clay and then throw on the potter’s wheel and finally learn to centre it.

20th July - Day 2

Shape and mould the clay and create various forms using hands and making handles, learning slab, coil and hand-building techniques. They will teach the group how to pull and push the clay body as desired to create various shapes & forms. Surface carving and decorating techniques.

21st July - Day 3:

Working on perfecting the shapes and sizes, controlling the forms, and continuing to practice throwing.

for Intermediate level pottery experience

Age requirement: Over the age of 12 years

Duration: 2 hours

Time: 11 am - 1 pm


Terms & Conditions

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event
  • Please be on time for your slot.
  • Do not purchase the tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.
  • No shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.

  • The schedule and the menu are subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.

document.name: Yoga Brunch with Julia
document.short_description:
Join us for the best possible start to your weekend!

A 60 minute flow with Julia followed by a nourishing delicious brunch by Copper + Cloves including smoothie bowls and buddha bowls. We'll be giving you previews of our new cafe menu!

After the class, you can experience our local, well-balanced, nutritious and seasonal menu spread. A beautiful way to get to know your peers in our serene space at The Studio.
